Authors:
Chuen-Hsu Fu, Huei-Mei Hsieh, Chi-Yu Chen, Tun-Tschu Chang,
Yao-Moan Huang, Yu-Ming Ju
Title:
Ophiodiaporthe cyatheae gen. et sp. nov., an ascomycete
causing a devastating wilt disease of Cyathea lepifera in Taiwan
Keywords:
Ascomycota, Cyathea lepifera, Diaporthaceae, Diaporthales,
pathogen, systematics
Abstract:
The scaly tree fern Cyathea lepifera in Taiwan has been
severely devastated by an ascomycete in recent years. This fungus
resembles species of Diaporthe, but, unlike anamorphic Diaporthe with
two types of conidia, its anamorph produces one conidium type only. It
is herein described as Ophiodiaporthe cyatheae gen. et sp. nov. Through
pathogenicity tests, O. cyatheae was demonstrated a causal agent of the
C. lepifera wilt disease. Interestingly, sporulating structures of O.
cyatheae have not been found on C. lepifera plants but in culture only.
The mating system is homothallic. Phylogenetic analyses based on
combined sequences of nSSU-rDNA, nLSU-rDNA, EF1-Î±, and RPB2 confirmed
that O. cyatheae is closely related to Diaporthe and should be accepted
in the Diaporthaceae.
